item.title: Dawn add a quote by Andy Warhol
item.description: "I always think about what it means to wear eyeglasses. When you get used to glasses you don't know how far you could really see. I think about all the people before eyeglasses were invented. It must have been weird because everyone was seeing in different ways according to how bad their eyes were. Now, eyeglasses standardize everyone's vision to 20-20. That's an example of everyone becoming more alike. Everyone could be seeing at different levels if it weren't for glasses." -- Andy Warhol

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Robert Browning
item.description: "Heart, fear nothing, for, heart, thou shalt find her- Next time, herself!-not the trouble behind her " -- Robert Browning

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "I will not be "famous," "great." I will go on adventuring, changing, opening my mind and my eyes, refusing to be stamped and stereotyped. The thing is to free one's self: to let it find its dimensions, not be impeded." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Andy Warhol
item.description: "I think having land and not ruining it is the most beautiful art that anybody could ever want." -- Andy Warhol

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Audrey Hepburn
item.description: "People, even more than things, have to be restored, renewed, revived, reclaimed, and redeemed; never throw out anyone." -- Audrey Hepburn

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description:
"<b>The preachers and lecturers deal with men of straw, as they are men of straw themselves</b>. Why, a free-spoken man, of sound lungs, cannot draw a long breath without causing your rotten institutions to come toppling down by the vacuum he makes. Your church is a baby-house made of blocks, and so of the state.
...The church, the state, the school, the magazine, think they are liberal and free! It is the freedom of a prison-yard." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description:
"It is not enough to be industrious; so are the ants. What are you industrious about?"
[<i>Letter to Harrison Blake</i>; November 16, 1857]" -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "The path of least resistance leads to crooked rivers and crooked men." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "What's the use of a fine house if you haven't got a tolerable planet to put it on?" -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "One farmer says to me, 'You cannot live on vegetable food solely, for it furnishes nothing to make bones with;' and so he religiously devotes a part of his day to supplying his system with the raw material of bones; walking all the while he talks behind his oxen, which, with vegetable-made bones, jerk him and his lumbering plow along in spite of every obstacle." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Everybody is a genius. But if you judge a fish by its ability to climb a tree, it will live its whole life believing that it is stupid." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Do not worry about your difficulties in Mathematics. I can assure you mine are still greater." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Andy Warhol
item.description: "They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself." -- Andy Warhol

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Andy Warhol
item.description: "People should fall in love with their eyes closed." -- Andy Warhol

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Andy Warhol
item.description: "When people are ready to, they change. They never do it before then, and sometimes they die before they get around to it. You can't make them change if they don't want to, just like when they do want to, you can't stop them." -- Andy Warhol

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Andy Warhol
item.description: "Sometimes the little times you don't think are anything while they're happening turn out to be what marks a whole period of your life." -- Andy Warhol

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Andy Warhol
item.description: "I can never get over when you're on the beach how beautiful the sand looks and the water washes it away and straightens it up and the trees and the grass all look great. I think having land and not ruining it is the most beautiful art that anybody could ever want to own." -- Andy Warhol

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Books are the mirrors of the soul." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "All extremes of feeling are allied with madness." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "There was a star riding through clouds one night, & I said to the star, 'Consume me'." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "They went in and out of each other's minds without any effort." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "So long as you write what you wish to write, that is all that matters; and whether it matters for ages or only for hours, nobody can say. " -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "You're beautiful, but you're empty...One couldn't die for you. Of course, an ordinary passerby would think my rose looked just like you. But my rose, all on her own, is more important than all of you together, since she's the one I've watered. Since she's the one I put under glass, since she's the one I sheltered behind the screen. Since she's the one for whom I killed the caterpillars (except the two or three butterflies). Since she's the one I listened to when she complained, or when she boasted, or even sometimes when she said nothing at all. Since she's my rose." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Antoine de Saint Exupéry
item.description: "If you were to say to the grown-ups: "I saw a beautiful house made of rosy brick, with geraniums in the windows and doves on the roof," they would not be able to get any idea of that house at all. You would have to say to them, "I saw a house that cost $20,000." Then they would exclaim, "Oh, what a pretty house that is!" -- Antoine de Saint Exupéry

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description:
"It is much more difficult to judge oneself than to judge others. If you succeed in judging yourself rightly, then you are indeed a man of true wisdom.
"What matters most are the simple pleasures so abundant that we can all enjoy them...Happiness doesn't lie in the objects we gather around us. To find it, all we need to do is open our eyes." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Why are you drinking? demanded the little prince. "So that I may forget," replied the tippler. "Forget what?" inquired the little prince, who was already sorry for him. "Forget that I am ashamed," the tippler confessed, hanging his head. "Ashamed of what?" insisted the little prince, who wanted to help him. "Ashamed of drinking!" -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "If he wants to be an asshole, it's a free country. Millions before him have made the same life choice." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "We understand more than we know." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "After everything that's happened, how can the world still be so beautiful? Because it is." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Dawn add a quote by Scott Adams
item.description: "Intelligence is a measure of how well you function within your level of awareness." -- Scott Adams
